dollar on the fall, yen on the rise

2004-03-19

So I was going to send money home back when dollars were around ¥105, but then they shot back up to ¥112, and now in the past week they have fallen back around ¥106... so the question is: buy, sell, or hold. I don't know much about international currency markets, but it seems like Japan wouldn't want the dollar to be any weaker than this. I have heard something like Bush is embracing a weak dollar (to help exports). Since I've been here it has been as high as ¥120 and as low as ¥105.
But I'm not going to think about it too much, lest I become Gordon Gekko.
